infos.info: The shows was broadcast by WMAQ, Chicago, and was never on a national network

synopses.synopsis: Destination Freedom, though it never appeared on a national network, was one of the most powerful and important shows of its day. It was a striking achievement, a voice whose passion and courage overcame every budgetary shortcoming to become perhaps the strongest plea for Negro rights ever heard on American radio... - On the Air: The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio by John Dunning
